decks.notes: This deck aims to quickly disrupt the opponent's game plan using cards like Wasteland, Hymn to Tourach, and Force of Will while applying pressure with efficient threats like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf. By combining disruptive spells with aggressive creatures, the deck seeks to control the board and reduce the opponent's resources, ultimately overwhelming them with a well-timed Tombstalker or a powerful planeswalker like Liliana, the Last Hope. The deck's flexibility in handling threats and disrupting the opponent's strategy makes it a strong contender in Legacy 1 vs 1 matchups.

The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Combo - Storm deck is to quickly generate mana using cards like Dark Ritual and Lion's Eye Diamond, drawing through the deck with cards like Brainstorm and Gitaxian Probe, and eventually casting a powerful storm spell like Ad Nauseam or Empty the Warrens to overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes disruptive elements like Duress and Cabal Therapy to control the opponent's hand and Burning Wish to access key sideboard cards, providing versatility and resilience in the face of opposing strategies.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on disrupting opponents with timely spells like Stifle and Force of Will, while also deploying threats like Delver of Secrets, True-Name Nemesis, and Gurmag Angler to apply pressure quickly. The deck also includes efficient removal options like Lightning Bolt and Dismember, as well as versatile mana fixing with fetch lands and dual lands. Overall, the deck aims to be proactive in disrupting opponents' game plans while also presenting a fast clock to close out games efficiently.

The main strategy of this Grixis Aggro deck is to apply pressure on the opponent early with cheap, efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Gurmag Angler, while disrupting their game plan with countermagic such as Spell Pierce, Force of Will, and Daze. The deck also uses utility lands like Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base and efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt to deal with threats. The deck aims to quickly close out the game before the opponent can stabilize, using aggressive creatures and disruption to control the flow of the game.

The deck focuses on using the combination of Show and Tell, Omniscience, and fast mana sources to cheat out powerful threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. With the ability to win the game as early as turn 1 or 2, the deck aims to resolve Show and Tell to put either Omniscience or a game-ending threat into play for free. The deck also includes cantrips, countermagic, and Cunning Wish to help find combo pieces, protect the combo, and interact with the opponent's game plan.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and True-Name Nemesis along with disruption spells like Daze and Force of Will to control the game. The deck also includes powerful cards like Deathrite Shaman and Gurmag Angler to apply pressure and close out games quickly. The mana base is streamlined with a focus on fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to all three colors of mana. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early threats and disruptive spells.

This deck aims to assemble the Food Chain combo as quickly as possible, using cards like Manipulate Fate and Misthollow Griffin to create an infinite loop of mana. Leovold, Emissary of Trest can disrupt opponents' strategies while also providing card draw. Walking Ballista can be a win condition once the combo is assembled. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Abrupt Decay to protect the combo and control the board. Overall, the focus is on efficiently generating mana and disrupting opponents to establish a dominant position.

The main idea of the deck is to use Cloudpost lands along with ramp and mana acceleration cards to quickly cast powerful Eldrazi creatures from your hand. By utilizing cards like Grim Monolith, Chalice of the Void, and Sorcerous Spyglass to control the game and disrupt your opponent's strategy, you can overwhelm them with massive creatures like Ulamog, Wurmcoil Engine, and Emrakul. The deck's ultimate goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and win the game through sheer size and strength.

The core strategy of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will, Thoughtseize, and Hymn to Tourach, while simultaneously applying pressure with efficient threats like True-Name Nemesis, Leovold, Emissary of Trest, and Baleful Strix. The deck leverages powerful cards like Umezawa's Jitte and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to gain incremental advantages and close out the game quickly. The inclusion of versatile removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay helps to control the board and protect valuable creatures. Overall, this deck aims to maintain a strong tempo advantage and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of disruption and aggression.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures quickly, taking advantage of mana acceleration with cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Ancient Tomb. Chalice of the Void and Sorcerous Spyglass disrupt opponents' strategies, while maintaining board control with threats like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck also includes utility lands like Eye of Ugin and Vesuva to support its Eldrazi theme. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure victory through efficient play and powerful threats.

This deck aims to disrupt opponent's plays with cards like Thoughtseize, Hymn to Tourach, and Force of Will, while maintaining board presence with cards like True-Name Nemesis, Leovold, Emissary of Trest, and Baleful Strix. It also has a strong mana denial strategy with Wasteland and can gain incremental advantage with cards like Umezawa's Jitte and Deathrite Shaman. The deck has a diverse range of answers to different threats with cards like Fatal Push, Abrupt Decay, and Diabolic Edict, making it versatile and adaptable to various matchups.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying threats like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer while disrupting the opponent with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck aims to control the board by utilizing efficient creatures and burn spells like Lightning Bolt, with Deathrite Shaman providing additional utility. By putting pressure on the opponent early in the game and maintaining a consistent stream of threats, this deck aims to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The key concept of this Legacy Grixis Aggro deck is to maintain tempo and pressure on the opponent through efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and True-Name Nemesis, while disrupting their game plan with cards like Daze, Wasteland, and Force of Will. The deck also utilizes card selection and manipulation with Brainstorm, Ponder, and Gitaxian Probe to ensure consistent draws. By combining aggression with disruption and card advantage, this deck aims to quickly close out games and prevent the opponent from stabilizing.

This deck is focused on controlling the game by using land destruction and recursion with Life from the Loam to manage resources and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also includes a toolbox of creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Green Sun's Zenith to answer different threats, while also including hand disruption with Liliana of the Veil and removal spells like Abrupt Decay. The deck aims to grind out advantage over time, using its various pieces to outvalue the opponent and eventually win the game through attrition.

The primary strategy of this UWx Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Counterbalance, Force of Will, and Unexpectedly Absent, the deck aims to maintain control of the game while generating incremental advantages with cards like Search for Azcanta and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. Additionally, the deck can also switch gears and present a proactive win condition through creatures like Monastery Mentor and Snapcaster Mage, allowing it to close out games efficiently once the opponent's resources are depleted.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of disruptive spells and versatile creatures. By utilizing cards like Snapcaster Mage, Leovold, Emissary of Trest, and Baleful Strix, the player can outvalue their opponent and gain incremental advantages. The deck also includes various removal spells like Fatal Push and Kolaghan's Command to deal with threats efficiently. Additionally, the inclusion of Force of Will and Thoughtseize allows the player to interact with their opponent's game plan and disrupt key cards. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's multicolored spells and ensure consistency in casting them. Overall, the deck aims to outmaneuver the opponent and control the game until victory.
